article.headline: Texas-Arlington 69, Nicholls St. 60
article.story: ARLINGTON, Texas (AP) -- Rod Epps scored 19 points, including four 3-pointers, as Texas-Arlington beat Nicholls State 69-60 Thursday night. With the win, the Mavericks stayed undefeated at home this season, and extended their home-court win streak to 15 games. Jermaine Griffin added 10 points and eight rebounds for the Mavericks (11-4, 1-2 Southland Conference). Ryan Bathis scored a game-high 27 points for the Colonels (6-12, 1-2), including 8 of 17 3-pointers. Anatoly Bose added 16 points off the bench for Nicholls State. Epps opened the game with a 3-pointer as the Mavericks raced to a 11-2 lead. Texas-Arlington never trailed in the game, but the Colonels closed the lead to 32-27 at the start of the second half. Two field goals by Rog'er Guignard and a jumper by Cardell Hunter pushed the Mavericks lead to 41-27 and they kept a double-digit lead until the final field goal by the Colonels. The Mavericks shot 48 percent from the field to only 35 percent for the Colonels.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
